filter-damaged.heading: Is your passport damanged?
filter-damaged.guidance:
I'm not sure if my passport is damaged

HM Passport Office classes your passport as damaged if:

* you can’t read any of your details
* the laminate cover has come away
* there’s an ink or chemical spillage on any of the pages
* there’s discolouring of your personal details (eg your name or date of birth)
* any of the pages are missing or detached
* the chip is damaged or showing through the back cover (e-passports only)
* there’s excess water damage

filter-dual-nationality.heading: Do you have dual nationality?
filter-dual-nationality.guidance: Do you have dual nationality if you’re a British citizen and a citizen of another country. For example, if you have a passport from another country.

renew-before-you-continue.heading: Before you continue
renew-before-you-continue.body:
It should take around 3 weeks to get your new passport. Use a different service if you need to get a passport urgently.

Applying for someone else

If you’re applying for someone who is unable to make their own decisions, you need to use a different service.

Changes to your face
If your face has changed because of an accident or illness such as a stroke, you need to apply in a different way. This doesn’t include the normal signs of ageing.

renew-how-to-apply.heading: How to apply for a passport online
renew-how-to-apply.body:
Get a digital passport photo
We’ll show you 3 ways to get a digital photo. Your photo must meet the rules for digital photos.
 
 2
 Apply online
 You’ll need to check the details in your old passport.
 
 3
 Pay for your new passport
 You’ll need a debit or credit card. A standard passport is £72.50 including special delivery.
4
 Send us your old passport
You need to pay the postage to return your old passport.

photo-digital-photo.heading: Get your digital passport photo
photo-digital-photo.body:
You can choose from 3 ways to get your digital photo.

Get a friend to take one
They can use a phone, tablet or digital camera. We’ll show you how to take a good passport photo and upload it.

Go to a photo shop
At a shop, you’ll get a digital copy of your photo. Some shops can also give you a photo code. We’ll show you how to use the code to retrieve your digital photo.

Go to a booth
From some booths in the UK and abroad, you’ll be able to get a photo code with your printed photos. We’ll show you how to use the code to retrieve your digital photo.

photo-choose-photo-method.guidance: [Get a friend to take one](), [Go to a booth or a shop]()

photo-retreive.heading: Retrieve your digital photo
photo-retreive.guidance: This is case-sensitive, for example abc.de/1fG2h3i4

photo-code-error.heading: We can't find your code
photo-code-error.guidance:
Check your code and try again. You need to enter the code exactly as it’s written.



You entered: abc.de/1fG2h3i4



If this keeps happening, contact the company that provided your digital photo.

photo-upload.heading: Upload your photo
photo-upload.guidance:
Your photo must meet the rules for digital passport photos.

Read the [photo guide](photo-guide).



We’ll store all photos for up to 30 days in line with our [privacy policy](https://www.passport.service.gov.uk/help/privacy).

photo-not-accepted.heading: You need another photo
photo-not-accepted.guidance:
This photo has failed our automated checks for the following reasons:

### It looks like you’re not facing the camera
If you tilt your head it may appear you’re not facing the camera.

You can still submit your photo if you believe it should be accepted (eg there’s a medical reason why you can’t face the camera).

###It looks like your mouth is open
Sometimes this is caused by facial hair or shadows near your mouth. Please try different lighting.

You can still submit your photo if you believe it should be accepted (eg there’s a medical reason why your mouth appears to be open).

###We can’t find the outline of your head
Our automated checks can’t find the outline of your head.

Please try:

* standing in front of a plain, light-coloured (eg, cream or grey) background
* tying your hair back or brushing it down if it’s loose
* standing further away from the wall to avoid shadows
* to make sure the background has no glare or patterns

filter-report-lost-or-stolen-passport.heading: You need a different service
filter-report-lost-or-stolen-passport.guidance:
You must [cancel your old passport](https://www.gov.uk/report-a-lost-or-stolen-passport) as soon as you can if it’s lost or stolen.
If you’ve already cancelled your passport you can apply for a replacement, or you can get a passport urgently with Fast Track (1 week).

otherTitle.label: Title in old passport
otherTitle._todo: Order of hint, should be above title
otherTitle.hint:
You can only use another title, such as a professional title or honour, if it’s already used in your old passport.

To use a new title you’ll need to [apply to update your passport](https://passportapplication.service.gov.uk/ips-olc/) instead.
